author: .fjl
content: the thing is, we want to include the log index into consensus for several reasons. the first reason that got us here is being able to prove the results of log search. but for the future, we want to extend the index to auto-log eth transfers and also to have an in-consensus transaction hash index.

author: .fjl
content: these are very important steps for UX

author: .fjl
content: there are many RPC operations which are currently impossible to prove

author: .fjl
content: for the future, we want to get to a world where the execution node will provide a fully trustless API

author: .fjl
content:
in order to make that useful, we need to prove:

- log search results
- tx hash lookup
- account eth balance changes from incoming transfers ("internal transactions")

author: marekm3498
content:
<@194432762315407360> qq about this test: eth_getTransactionReceipt/get-legacy-input

Is there any reason why status shouldn't be return? We do return status for legacy txs, while geth doesn't?

author: .fjl
content: We have it in Geth, as an extension. Also there is an active proposal somewhere for a version of eth_simulate that does gas estimation

author: .fjl
content: The underlying receipt can either store the post-state `root` or the `status` but not both. It was changed in EIP-658 (Byzantium fork). When `root` is set, before byzantium, the `status` is meaningless, because it is not defined by consensus.
